ul.li1: 1Come near, nations, to hear;
ul.li2: and peoples, listen attentively!
ul.li1: Let the earth hear, and that which fills it;
ul.li2: the world and all its offspring.
ul.li1: 2For the anger of Yahweh is against all the nations,
ul.li2: and his wrath is against all their armies;
ul.li1: he has put them under a ban,
ul.li2: he has given them up for slaughter.
ul.li1: 3And their slain shall be cast out;
ul.li2: as forOr “and” their corpses, their stench shall go up.
ul.li1: And the mountains shall melt withOr “from” their blood,
ul.li2: 4and all the host of heaven shall rot.
ul.li1: And the skies shall roll up like a scroll,
ul.li2: and all their host shall wither
ul.li1: like the withering of a leaf from a vine,
ul.li2: orOr “and” like the withering from a fig tree.

chapter.p: 5When my sword is drenched in the heavens,

ul.li1: look! It will descend upon Edom,
ul.li2: and upon the people of my ban, for judgment.

chapter.p: 6Yahweh has a sword;Literally “A sword for Yahweh”

ul.li1: it is full of blood.
ul.li2: It is covered withOr “from” fat,
ul.li1: withOr “from” the blood of lambs and goats,
ul.li2: withOr “from” the fat of the kidneys of rams,
ul.li1: for Yahweh has a sacrificeLiterally “a sacrifice for Yahweh” in Bozrah
ul.li2: and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
ul.li1: 7And wild oxen shall go down with them,
ul.li2: and steers with strong bulls.
ul.li1: And their land shall be drenched withOr “from” blood,
ul.li2: and their soil shall be fattened withOr “from” fat.
ul.li1: 8For Yahweh has a day of vengeance,Literally “a day of vengeance for Yahweh”
ul.li2: a year of retribution for the strife of Zion.
ul.li1: 9And its streams shall be changed to pitch and its soil to sulfur,
ul.li2: and its land shall become like burning pitch.
ul.li1: 10Night and day it shall not be quenched;
ul.li2: its smoke shall go up forever.
ul.li1: From generation to generation it shall be in ruins;
ul.li2: forever and ever there will be no one who passes through her.
ul.li1: 11ButOr “And” the large bird and the hedgehog shall take possession of it,
ul.li2: and the owl and the raven shall live in it.
ul.li1: And he shall stretch the measuring line of confusion out over it,
ul.li2: and the plumb line of emptiness.
ul.li1: 12Its nobles—but no kingdom is there—shall call,
ul.li2: and all its princes shall be nothing.
ul.li1: 13And thorns shall go up her citadel fortress,
ul.li2: weedsHebrew “weed” and thistle plantsHebrew “thistle plant” in her fortresses;
ul.li1: and it shall be the settlement of jackals,
ul.li2: green grass for the daughters of an ostrich.
ul.li1: 14And desert creatures shall meet with hyenas,
ul.li2: and a goat-demon shall call to his neighbor;
ul.li1: surely there LilithHebrew transliteration; possibly a proper name for a Mesopotamian night-demon shall repose,
ul.li2: and she shall find a resting place for herself.
ul.li1: 15There the owl shall nest and lay
ul.li2: and hatch and care for her chicks in her shadow;
ul.li1: surely there the birds of prey shall be gathered,
ul.li2: each one with her mate.

chapter.p: 16Seek from the book of Yahweh and read;Literally “call”

ul.li1: none of these shall be missing;
ul.li2: none shall miss her mate.
ul.li1: For myThe Dead Sea Scroll has “his” mouth is the one thatLiterally “he” has commanded,
ul.li2: and his spirit is the one thatLiterally “he” has gathered them.
ul.li1: 17And he is the one thatLiterally “he” has cast the lot for them,
ul.li2: and his hand has apportioned it to them with the measuring line;
ul.li1: they shall take possession of it forever,
ul.li2: they shall live in it from generation to generation.Literally “to generation and generation”
